etymology.description: semantic: 心(心) (xīn, "heart") + phonetic: 亡(亡) (wáng, "perish") = heart in turmoil -> busy
etymology.interpretation: 忙(忙) (máng, "busy") combines 心(心) (xīn, "heart") for the emotional aspect with 亡(亡) (wáng, "perish") which lends its sound, capturing the sense of a heart overwhelmed with activities.

examples.chinese: 我今天很忙(我今天很忙)。
他虽然很忙(他雖然很忙)，仍然抽时间学习(仍然抽時間學習)。
examples.pinyin: Tā suīrán hěn máng, réngrán chōu shíjiān xuéxí.
examples.english: Although he is busy, he still finds time to study.

examples.chinese: 忙于工作的人(忙於工作的人)，总是忘记休息(總是忘記休息)。
examples.pinyin: Máng yú gōngzuò de rén, zǒng shì wàngjì xiūxí.
examples.english: People who are busy at work always forget to rest.
